commit_message:
OpenShift: Properly disable bare metal OVS

We're deploying containerized OpenShift, which means openshift-ansible
deploys also containerized OVS. When not disabled explicitly, the bare
metal OVS service seemed to persist at least partially, and it likely
caused issues with the containerized OVS, where nodes in `kubectl get
nodes` would go from Ready status to NotReady shortly after the
deployment finished.

Change-Id: I8952198be7f78a699cf363af2e10f26714e94850
Closes-Bug: #1741224

commit_message:
Add a health check for overcloud nodes

This adds a basic connection check to see if nodes are in a state where
they can be connected to, prior to an upgrade or a scale-up.

The validation uses data from Nova and Ironic to display more detailed
info in the failing nodes.

Change-Id: I3b098fd2aa169397e73757fb44941011c9206678

commit_message:
Fix the service name for aodh

The service name registered in tempest is aodh, not aodh_plugin
This is causing some confusing in other projects when ceilometer
tests checks for a service called aodh_plugin.

Change-Id: Ib77d29230aecd6148a02d1bd353b35d769291fdd

Omitting it makes forking or renaming projects easier.

commit_message:
Fix UnicodeDecodeError when decode API input

Convert UnicodeDecodeError to HTTPBadRequest in
FaultWrapper.

**NOTE**: Cinder will raise 500 error when failed to decode invalid
unicode character at anyplace where try to collect url
parematers as below:

```
params = req.params
```

This patch converts this kind of exception into BadRequest, plus
an explicit error message.

Change-Id: I816f05084b0a0ef670ef293d381868409b96ed7d
Closes-Bug: #1746202

subject: Fix KEY_SHIFT keycode for libvirt
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-02-05 16:05:16.000000000', 'files': ['labs/osbash/lib/osbash/kvm-keycodes.sh', 'labs/stacktrain/kvm/keycodes.py'], 'message': 'Fix KEY_SHIFT keycode for libvirt

In 2017, libvirt changed the way they handle keycodes (presumably when
they switched to the keycodemapdb repo). They dropped the KEY_SHIFT
keycode which used to be mapped to KEY_LEFTSHIFT, resulting in an
error "invalid keycode: 'KEY_SHIFT'" when building the basedisk with
KVM.

Fortunately, KEY_LEFTSHIFT existed before, so we can just use that and
it will work on both new and old versions of libvirt.

Change-Id: Iaddd068a6ee19d8c7f027558dcf3d3efea26dbbb
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Fix KEY_SHIFT keycode for libvirt

In 2017, libvirt changed the way they handle keycodes (presumably when
they switched to the keycodemapdb repo). They dropped the KEY_SHIFT
keycode which used to be mapped to KEY_LEFTSHIFT, resulting in an
error "invalid keycode: 'KEY_SHIFT'" when building the basedisk with
KVM.

Fortunately, KEY_LEFTSHIFT existed before, so we can just use that and
it will work on both new and old versions of libvirt.

Change-Id: Iaddd068a6ee19d8c7f027558dcf3d3efea26dbbb

commit_message:
Add index(instance_uuid, updated_at) on instance_actions table

A database index is added on the ``(instance_uuid, updated_at)``
 columns in the ``nova.instance_actions`` table to improve the
performance of filtering instance actions by the 'changes-since'
parameter.

Change-Id: Id79aa297c3248002a271e905dccd2c3ba27848c7
Implement: blueprint pagination-add-changes-since-for-instance-action-list

commit_message:
Reorder final boot order for node VMs

For some of the optional services we have in the pipeline, the compute
node needs to be up when the scripts run on the controller node.
Therefore, we start the compute node first and the controller node
second.

Change-Id: I421a9bde38d4ea63dae2c8d75c1e20e907ad1d4c

', 'number': 1}, {'created': '2018-01-04 10:00:39.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': '[WIP] Fix 500 in test_resize_server_negative_invalid_state

Change-Id: Ie6efee14d4b4d25a73dc23f0649a56bfa724c492
Closes-Bug: #1741220
', 'number': 2}, {'created': '2018-01-05 07:04:05.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Fix 500 in test_resize_server_negative_invalid_state

In some case(such as, delete a confirmResize server), the
actions maybe have same instance_uuid and request_id. When
we record the event we should get the last created action,
otherwise, we would find the wrong action, and we can't find
the specific event using this wrong action id. Finally, raise
a 500 error due to the error of InstanceActionEventNotFound.

So, if more than one actions with same instance uuid and request
id are exists. we should choice the last created action id as
event record action id.

This change fixes this by sorting action by desc(created_at, id)
and get back the last created action.

Change-Id: Ie6efee14d4b4d25a73dc23f0649a56bfa724c492
Closes-Bug: #1741220

commit_message:
Fix 500 in test_resize_server_negative_invalid_state

In some case(such as, delete a confirmResize server), the
actions maybe have same instance_uuid and request_id. When
we record the event we should get the last created action,
otherwise, we would find the wrong action, and we can't find
the specific event using this wrong action id. Finally, raise
a 500 error due to the error of InstanceActionEventNotFound.

So, if more than one actions with same instance uuid and request
id are exists. we should choice the last created action id as
event record action id.

This change fixes this by sorting action by desc(created_at, id)
and get back the last created action.

Change-Id: Ie6efee14d4b4d25a73dc23f0649a56bfa724c492
Closes-Bug: #1741220

commit_message:
Release and cut queens branch for neutron-vpnaas and dashboard

In Queens release neutron-vpnaas and its dashboard use
the cycle-with-intermediary release model, but it is nice to cut
stable/queens at the same timing as for other neutron projects.

In addition, the i18n team will sets up stable/queens branch
on the translation platform around RC1 release, so it is helpful
if neutron-vpnaas-dashboard has a stable branch now.

Change-Id: Ie1e0592a22e2a97f60e49adf1583587925ed0e6a

commit_message:
upstream_version(): allow specifying pypi name

This commit adds an optional pypi_name parameter to
upstream_version. This allows calling it multiple times for
specs that build packages from more than one pypi package and
thus cannot work with a single pypi_name context variable.

One example of this situation would be the monasca-ceilometer
package which is built from the monasca-ceilometer and
ceilometer pypi packages.

Change-Id: I4c39fadce3bf4ce91d65eab5cc95b893a1379be2

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 1653, 'name': 'garyk', 'email': 'gkotton@vmware.com', 'username': 'garyk'}, {'_account_id': 2750, 'name': 'Sean Dague', 'email': 'sean@dague.net', 'username': 'sdague'}, {'_account_id': 5196, 'name': 'Matthew Treinish', 'email': 'mtreinish@kortar.org', 'username': 'treinish'}, {'_account_id': 9303, 'name': 'Abhishek Kekane', 'email': 'akekane@redhat.com', 'username': 'abhishekkekane'}, {'_account_id': 10118, 'name': 'IBM PowerKVM CI', 'email': 'kvmpower@linux.vnet.ibm.com', 'username': 'powerkvm', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 11564, 'name': 'Chris Dent', 'email': 'cdent@anticdent.org', 'username': 'chdent'}, {'_account_id': 14070, 'name': 'Eric Fried', 'email': 'openstack@fried.cc', 'username': 'efried'}, {'_account_id': 16376, 'name': 'Intel NFV CI', 'email': 'openstack-nfv-ci@intel.com', 'username': 'intel-nfv-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 25033, 'name': 'Eric Young', 'email': 'eric.young@dell.com', 'username': 'tssgery'}, {'_account_id': 26101, 'name': 'Ellen Batbouta', 'email': 'ellen.batbouta@oracle.com', 'username': 'ellen.batbouta'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2017-08-10 19:02:58.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Remove proxy-sendcl from mod_proxy_uwsgi apache path

Calling setenv appears to be globally scoped which is breaking the
glance path which relies on chunked uploads. The glance path is
separated by using mod_proxy instead of mod_proxy_uwsgi because
mod_proxy_uwsgi doesn't support chunked encoding.[1] The proxy-sendcl [2]
was set on the mod_proxy_uwsgi path just in case someone tried to send a
chunked request to the api server we would be able to handle it. It
tells apache to locally cache the chunked request and send the
content-length as a normal upload to the upstream server. However, if we
can only set it globally across then small potential benefit is not worth
having all glance uploads cached by apache. This commit just removes
setting the flag. In the future if we can have devstack isolate this
flag it might be worth adding back to the mod_proxy_uwsgi path, but for
right now it's not worth the tradeoff.

[1] https://github.com/unbit/uwsgi/issues/1540
[2] https://httpd.apache.org/docs/2.4/mod/mod_proxy.html#request-bodies

Change-Id: Iab2e2848877fa1497008d18c05b0154892941589
Closes-Bug: #1709970
", 'number': 1}, {'created': '2017-08-10 23:23:16.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Remove proxy-sendcl from mod_proxy_uwsgi apache path

Calling setenv appears to be globally scoped which is breaking the
glance path which relies on chunked uploads. The glance path is
separated by using mod_proxy instead of mod_proxy_uwsgi because
mod_proxy_uwsgi doesn't support chunked encoding.[1] The proxy-sendcl [2]
was set on the mod_proxy_uwsgi path just in case someone tried to send a
chunked request to the api server we would be able to handle it. It
tells apache to locally cache the chunked request and send the
content-length as a normal upload to the upstream server. However, if we
can only set it globally across then small potential benefit is not worth
having all glance uploads cached by apache. This commit just removes
setting the flag. In the future if we can have devstack isolate this
flag it might be worth adding back to the mod_proxy_uwsgi path, but for
right now it's not worth the tradeoff.

As part of this there were some misconfigurations in apache and uwsgi
around handling chunked encoding. This was overlooked because we weren't
actually chunking it over the proxy connection to glance/uwsgi. When we
stopped setting sendcl in apache things stopped working because uwsgi
didn't know how to handle the data.

[1] https://github.com/unbit/uwsgi/issues/1540
[2] https://httpd.apache.org/docs/2.4/mod/mod_proxy.html#request-bodies

Calling setenv appears to be globally scoped which is breaking the

mod_proxy_uwsgi doesn't support chunked encoding.[1] The proxy-sendcl [2]
was set on the mod_proxy_uwsgi path just in case someone tried to send a
chunked request to the api server we would be able to handle it. It
tells apache to locally cache the chunked request and send the

can only set it globally across then small potential benefit is not worth
having all glance uploads cached by apache. This commit just removes
setting the flag. In the future if we can have devstack isolate this

commit_message:
Remove proxy-sendcl from mod_proxy_uwsgi apache path

Calling setenv appears to be globally scoped which is breaking the
glance path which relies on chunked uploads. The glance path is
separated by using mod_proxy instead of mod_proxy_uwsgi because
mod_proxy_uwsgi doesn't support chunked encoding.[1] The proxy-sendcl [2]
was set on the mod_proxy_uwsgi path just in case someone tried to send a
chunked request to the api server we would be able to handle it. It
tells apache to locally cache the chunked request and send the
content-length as a normal upload to the upstream server. However, if we
can only set it globally across then small potential benefit is not worth
having all glance uploads cached by apache. This commit just removes
setting the flag. In the future if we can have devstack isolate this
flag it might be worth adding back to the mod_proxy_uwsgi path, but for
right now it's not worth the tradeoff.

[1] https://github.com/unbit/uwsgi/issues/1540
[2] https://httpd.apache.org/docs/2.4/mod/mod_proxy.html#request-bodies

Depends-On: Idf6b4b891ba31cccbeb53d373b40fce5380cea64
Change-Id: Iab2e2848877fa1497008d18c05b0154892941589
Closes-Bug: #1709970

commit_message:
Move translation scripts out of jenkins/scripts

No need to install these files on all nodes. Instead copy them over only
when needed and place them together in the translation directory.

Change-Id: Iebffa4f7b5998f2e1a3ee660f1242a11abf1e3f8

commit_message:
Sync changes in scripts dir to node VMs

Until now, the scripts directory has not been synced to the node VMs
because each script was copied there prior to execution. This method
does not work if a script needs additional files (e.g., configuration)
that reside in the scripts directory. This is what we plan to do for
some optional services which will come in separate sub-directories
such as scripts/ubuntu/tacker.

Therefore, this changeset ensures that the scripts directory is copied
to the target node VM before script execution begins.

Change-Id: Iee4ed2fdc99045e779575a68a5c19c35895bdbd8

subject: bug fix: rename accelerator to Accelerator
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-02-08 09:34:04.000000000', 'files': ['cyborg/accelerator/accelerator.py', 'cyborg/accelerator/drivers/generic_driver.py'], 'message': 'bug fix: rename accelerator to Accelerator

When run:
$ python -m unittest cyborg.tests.unit.accelerator.drivers.modules.test_generic

It will report the follow error:
  File "cyborg/tests/unit/accelerator/drivers/modules/test_generic.py", line 20, in <module>
    from cyborg.accelerator.drivers.generic_driver import GenericDriver as generic
  File "cyborg/accelerator/drivers/generic_driver.py", line 24, in <module>
    from cyborg.accelerator import accelerator
  File "cyborg/accelerator/accelerator.py", line 23, in <module>
    class accelerator(Base):
  File "/usr/local/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/sqlalchemy/ext/declarative/api.py", line 64, in __init__
    _as_declarative(cls, classname, cls.__dict__)
  File "/usr/local/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/sqlalchemy/ext/declarative/base.py", line 88, in _as_declarative
    _MapperConfig.setup_mapping(cls, classname, dict_)
  File "/usr/local/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/sqlalchemy/ext/declarative/base.py", line 103, in setup_mapping
    cfg_cls(cls_, classname, dict_)
  File "/usr/local/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/sqlalchemy/ext/declarative/base.py", line 125, in __init__
    clsregistry.add_class(self.classname, self.cls)
  File "/usr/local/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/sqlalchemy/ext/declarative/clsregistry.py", line 65, in add_class
    module.add_class(classname, cls)
  File "/usr/local/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/sqlalchemy/ext/declarative/clsregistry.py", line 172, in add_class
    existing.add_item(cls)
AttributeError: '_ModuleMarker' object has no attribute 'add_item'

That's because:
_ModuleMarker will add the module name and class name in to same contents dict.
_MultipleClassMarker refers to multiple classes of the same name within _decl_class_registry.
It has add_item attribute.
_ModuleMarker refers to a module name within _decl_class_registry.
It does not have add_item attribute.

So the class name should be different with module name.

REF:
https://github.com/zzzeek/sqlalchemy/blob/master/lib/sqlalchemy/ext/declarative/clsregistry.py

Change-Id: I8d8aa8809f6afd5b9eaace832a06ba7f3770e652
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
bug fix: rename accelerator to Accelerator

When run:
$ python -m unittest cyborg.tests.unit.accelerator.drivers.modules.test_generic

It will report the follow error:
  File "cyborg/tests/unit/accelerator/drivers/modules/test_generic.py", line 20, in <module>
    from cyborg.accelerator.drivers.generic_driver import GenericDriver as generic
  File "cyborg/accelerator/drivers/generic_driver.py", line 24, in <module>
    from cyborg.accelerator import accelerator
  File "cyborg/accelerator/accelerator.py", line 23, in <module>
    class accelerator(Base):
  File "/usr/local/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/sqlalchemy/ext/declarative/api.py", line 64, in __init__
    _as_declarative(cls, classname, cls.__dict__)
  File "/usr/local/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/sqlalchemy/ext/declarative/base.py", line 88, in _as_declarative
    _MapperConfig.setup_mapping(cls, classname, dict_)
  File "/usr/local/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/sqlalchemy/ext/declarative/base.py", line 103, in setup_mapping
    cfg_cls(cls_, classname, dict_)
  File "/usr/local/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/sqlalchemy/ext/declarative/base.py", line 125, in __init__
    clsregistry.add_class(self.classname, self.cls)
  File "/usr/local/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/sqlalchemy/ext/declarative/clsregistry.py", line 65, in add_class
    module.add_class(classname, cls)
  File "/usr/local/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/sqlalchemy/ext/declarative/clsregistry.py", line 172, in add_class
    existing.add_item(cls)
AttributeError: '_ModuleMarker' object has no attribute 'add_item'

That's because:
_ModuleMarker will add the module name and class name in to same contents dict.
_MultipleClassMarker refers to multiple classes of the same name within _decl_class_registry.
It has add_item attribute.
_ModuleMarker refers to a module name within _decl_class_registry.
It does not have add_item attribute.

So the class name should be different with module name.

REF:
https://github.com/zzzeek/sqlalchemy/blob/master/lib/sqlalchemy/ext/declarative/clsregistry.py

Change-Id: I8d8aa8809f6afd5b9eaace832a06ba7f3770e652

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-02-06 20:05:14.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'DNM: Debug nova-next failure: connection params

Debugging failures in nova-next job.  We can make the job pass by not
using the ServiceTokenAuthWrapper at all [1].  This is one of several
changes to narrow down which bit of ServiceTokenAuthWrapper is causing
the issue:

Make ServiceTokenAuthWrapper.get_headers pass through the user headers
instead of adding the auth token.

Make ServiceTokenAuthWrapper.invalidate only invalidate the user token.

==> This patch ==> Make ServiceTokenAuthWrapper.get_connection_params
return only the user params.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/541008/3

Change-Id: I73d36440699487bb8707243e85a8a3580c875af6

commit_message:
DNM: Debug nova-next failure: connection params

Debugging failures in nova-next job.  We can make the job pass by not
using the ServiceTokenAuthWrapper at all [1].  This is one of several
changes to narrow down which bit of ServiceTokenAuthWrapper is causing
the issue:

Make ServiceTokenAuthWrapper.get_headers pass through the user headers
instead of adding the auth token.

Make ServiceTokenAuthWrapper.invalidate only invalidate the user token.

==> This patch ==> Make ServiceTokenAuthWrapper.get_connection_params
return only the user params.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/541008/3

Change-Id: I73d36440699487bb8707243e85a8a3580c875af6
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/541431

DNM: Debug nova-next failure: user headers

Debugging failures in nova-next job.  We can make the job pass by not
using the ServiceTokenAuthWrapper at all [1].  This is one of several
changes to narrow down which bit of ServiceTokenAuthWrapper is causing
the issue:

==> This patch ==> Make ServiceTokenAuthWrapper.get_headers pass through
the user headers instead of adding the auth token.

Make ServiceTokenAuthWrapper.invalidate only invalidate the user token.

Make ServiceTokenAuthWrapper.get_connection_params return only the user
params.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/541008/3

Change-Id: Ie5ea5ffaf1214fdfbe1bd1238b1ed99d43828d12

commit_message:
Zuul: Remove project name

Zuul no longer requires the project-name for in-repo configuration.
Omitting it makes forking or renaming projects easier.

Change-Id: I7f1e46f8985fe9b5260c5bc7a680db63583fef86

subject: Fix vm_scp_to_vm for directories
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-02-02 07:12:17.000000000', 'files': ['labs/stacktrain/core/ssh.py', 'labs/osbash/lib/osbash/functions-host.sh'], 'message': 'Fix vm_scp_to_vm for directories

This changeset fixes an issue with vm_scp_to_vm (both bash and Python
implementations). When called to copy the same directory more than once,
the second copy (and all subsequent calls) end up writing into the wrong
location because they create the target directory once more within the
target directory.

This changeset makes the method idempotent for directories, too.

Change-Id: I1644f12ae5be39e6c9921d08910891046ffa593e
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Fix vm_scp_to_vm for directories

This changeset fixes an issue with vm_scp_to_vm (both bash and Python
implementations). When called to copy the same directory more than once,
the second copy (and all subsequent calls) end up writing into the wrong
location because they create the target directory once more within the
target directory.

This changeset makes the method idempotent for directories, too.

Change-Id: I1644f12ae5be39e6c9921d08910891046ffa593e

commit_message:
Prevent latest mariadb version

Latest mariadb version has a bug that prevents clustering from
behaving properly in bootstrap.

This setups the repo for the galera_client to the same as
galera_server, to have the same client version.

Change-Id: Ia1d7a2c664c6c11ad698a915162281c11a344067
(cherry picked from commit 70249b98c537eeeb45d7afadcfd6232fced579d9)

commit_message:
Prevent latest mariadb version

Latest mariadb version has a bug that prevents clustering from
behaving properly in bootstrap.

This setups the repo for the galera_client to the same as
galera_server, to have the same client version.

For OpenSUSE, we need to switch from OBS to MariaDB upstream repo.
It therefore needs a backport from a previous patch:
"Switch to upstream MariaDB repository"

Change-Id: Ia1d7a2c664c6c11ad698a915162281c11a344067
(manually cherry picked from commit bb6feac7aba85d4467d8ff05031546a1b2a9162b)
(manually cherry picked from commit 70249b98c537eeeb45d7afadcfd6232fced579d9)

commit_message:
Remove ceilometer (Telemetry) service

The ceilometer scripts have not been updated nor tested in a long time.
They have been disabled by default since Newton. We can patch them up
and add them back if needed.

Change-Id: Ie53f1cd195e4d72df7271ea5f1fd4095fda5e290

commit_message:
Replace the old keypair in clusters for API v2

This commit fix keypair loss for API v2.
We can make up for the keypair by public key, or keypair name when
the value of keypair_public_key is null.

Change-Id: I7a18486870bcfee284fef5ce7b34e57409f6f424

commit_message:
Network topology "Graph" tab always shows nothing

Network topology "Graph" tab always says "There are no networks,
routers, or connected instances to display."
This happens after a fix for bug 1661350
(commit f35eaa2d13fc5aff31b9a83dc729cc20b91fc611) was merged.

The problem with that in checking the length of object.
So always will be equal undefined,
also check the object before getting filled.

Closes-Bug: #1747196
Change-Id: I72dd8d2b472677411635f58309c780a8d602ffe3

commit_message:
Prevent latest mariadb version

Latest mariadb version has a bug that prevents clustering from
behaving properly in bootstrap.

For openSUSE, we need to switch from OBS to MariaDB upstream repo.
It therefore needs a backport from a previous patch:
"Switch to upstream MariaDB repository". We also need to configure
PrivateDevices before starting the service which is based on the
588b9cead7637cc73cc8607e2460fea24cc6e2b0 backport and
baa97f1df2035e2db969152f64b28b791e25d3d9 master commit. This also
removes the SUSE specific cases from the tasks and handlers since they
are no longer necessary when using the upstream packages.

(manually cherry picked from commit a37bfcca09e4cfe92f4732ae10d30b9c82f586c2)
(manually cherry picked from commit c54e9a68bc10380a5fad3363a8647994b033c8c2)

Change-Id: I21e96dbe7fd9acaedb7eee7cba2ae226fa0644d5

It leads to ClassNotFound Exception when we run a job by Oozie.
This patch adds a dependency to share/lib/oozie.pom.xml to fix

Change-Id: Ifad65cfef75024c31fa260707e1626b7f7fa75a8
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Insert a dependency into oozie/sharelib

Hadoop 2.8.2 version has a change that removed the httpclient
dependency from hadoop-openstack[1].
It leads to ClassNotFound Exception when we run a job by Oozie.
This patch adds a dependency to share/lib/oozie.pom.xml to fix
the error.
And after this change, Sahara doesn't need to upload the
common-httpclient.jar to sharelib when cluster starts up.

[1]: https://github.com/apache/hadoop/commit/62579b69a0a294ba1ea14cf76c650b640f89f331

Change-Id: Ifad65cfef75024c31fa260707e1626b7f7fa75a8

commit_message:
Manually submit nodes assignment form

Due to changes in updateParameters Mistral action which now validates
parameters, which takes quite long time, we need to change nodes
assignment form to be submitted manually rather than automatically
using debounce.

* introduce 'Save changes' and 'Cancel' buttons which
appear when user changes nodes counts
* Add overlay loader to role cards when parameters are being updated

Closes-Bug: 1746506
Change-Id: If0faab92ba516ca73cfb0e93eb4db8de68042d82

commit_message:
Update MariaDB CentOS yum mirror URL

The yum mirrors for MariaDB have changes to the directory structure.
This patch updates the directory structure and chooses a faster
mirror from the US to use for installation.

Closes-Bug: 1747740
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/541419
Change-Id: I5f1ecb71c6125c29d6487bef6c2be215c1b561c1

commit_message:
Move options out of the OpenShiftMaster template

Some of the options that had been hard-coded in the openshift-master
template should be configuratble in a per-deployment bases. This patch
moves them out into an environment file instead.

Change-Id: I4b6f6180b11f36b1212b9e887365a99b6ae12017

commit_message:
Add --live-restore to the docker_options in puppet/services/docker.yaml

Via change Ib3ea6de7f235d2a2d53a6576e0876ab171128b34 we added
--live-restore to the default options in the
tripleo::profile::base::docker manifest. This is insufficient, because
we explicitely set the tripleo::profile::base::docker::docker_options
hiera key in the templates. So let's change the defaults there as well.

Change-Id: Ia2d7fe4f3a818c2986a44d8b0effe04d5228301e
Related-Bug: #1747851

commit_message:
fix issue where containers can not update successfully

This patch enables the centos base repo such that
new dependencies can be installed.

Closes-Bug: #1747986
Change-Id: Ie4778908a6510d07206e93994675f4c886313d6e

subject: Drop LBaaS
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-02-02 07:12:17.000000000', 'files': ['labs/osbash/config/scripts.ubuntu_cluster', 'labs/osbash/config/scripts.ubuntu_pxecluster', 'labs/osbash/scripts/ubuntu/setup_lbaas_network.sh', 'labs/osbash/scripts/ubuntu/setup_lbaas_controller.sh'], 'message': 'Drop LBaaS

Our LBaaS v1 scripts stopped working with the Kilo release, and they
have never been migrated to LBaaS v2 which is due to become deprecated
soon [1][2].

It is time to retire the scripts for this service. LBaaS can be
reintroduced when we have someone to write a script for Octavia.

[1] http://specs.openstack.org/openstack/neutron-specs/specs/newton/kill-neutron-lbaas.html
[2] https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/Neutron/LBaaS/Deprecation

Change-Id: I8872dd4298dfc7fbfc4e53a403abd818b3ef47a8
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Drop LBaaS

Our LBaaS v1 scripts stopped working with the Kilo release, and they
have never been migrated to LBaaS v2 which is due to become deprecated
soon [1][2].

It is time to retire the scripts for this service. LBaaS can be
reintroduced when we have someone to write a script for Octavia.

[1] http://specs.openstack.org/openstack/neutron-specs/specs/newton/kill-neutron-lbaas.html
[2] https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/Neutron/LBaaS/Deprecation

Change-Id: I8872dd4298dfc7fbfc4e53a403abd818b3ef47a8

commit_message:
Fix pike GA prelude release note

This should say that the maximum compute API microversion
in *Pike* is 2.53, not Ocata.

This change is only made on the stable/pike branch so
as to not cause issues with it showing up again as a new
release note.

Change-Id: I415504f5ba669cea544f0144ea529b88094be741

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-07-23 20:30:11.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'libvirt: make snapshot use RBD snapshot/clone when available

When rbd is used for ephemeral disks and image storage, make snapshot
use ceph directly, and update glance with the new location.  In
case of failure, it will gracefully fallback to the "generic"
snapshot method.

This requires changing the typical permissions for the nova ceph
user (if using authx) to allow writing to the pool where vm images
are stored.

DocImpact
Implements: blueprint implement-rbd-snapshots-instead-of-qemu-snapshots
Change-Id: If13d25b6c94e247d2505583b524ae3af9c34b5dc

commit_message:
libvirt: make snapshot use RBD snapshot/clone when available

When rbd is used for ephemeral disks and image storage, make snapshot
use ceph directly, and update glance with the new location.  In
case of failure, it will gracefully fallback to the "generic"
snapshot method.

This requires changing the typical permissions for the nova ceph
user (if using authx) to allow writing to the pool where vm images
are stored, and it also requires configuring Glance to provide a
v2 endpoint with direct_url support enabled (there are security
implications to doing this).

Spec: Ia3666d53e663eacf8c65dbffbd4bc847dd948171

DocImpact: Ceph and Glance configuration changes
Implements: blueprint rbd-instance-snapshots
Change-Id: If13d25b6c94e247d2505583b524ae3af9c34b5dc

commit_message:
Fix LVM driver not handling IPv6 in recovery mode

Recovery mode is currently used by host-assisted share
migration to bulk remove and add back rules while casting
them to read only.

Unfortunately, it is not handling IPv6 addresses when removing
the rules in this code path. This patch adds a call to a function
that handles the IPv6 addresses, adding brackets around them.

Change-Id: Icba4b22ad87ccfabcc02078648b1abc6410e5353
Closes-bug: #1746723

commit_message:
Revert consumed quota when failed to create group from source group

When failed to created corresponding volumes in group, Cinder
will destory the volume object, but consumed quota is left.

Change-Id: Ief0637768cf1fe04bb4162e02008b4884a184051

commit_message:
Enable more extensions in pep8

This patch enable extensions:
-[H204] Use assert(Not)Equal to check for equality.
-[H205] Use assert(Greater|Less)(Equal) for comparison.

Change-Id: I31084170cd4cd4f4626aac459d9a61a4c5c67153

subject: Re-enable heat (Orchestration) service
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-02-02 07:12:17.000000000', 'files': ['labs/osbash/config/scripts.ubuntu_cluster'], 'message': 'Re-enable heat (Orchestration) service

Heat has been disabled by default with the Ocata updates because we kept
running into memory shortages. The other measures aimed at reducing RAM
usage introduced at the same time seem to have paid off, allowing us to
re-enable heat again.

Change-Id: Iff669dfba3d5d98cac603601af2d86f4d2c5ee4c
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Re-enable heat (Orchestration) service

Heat has been disabled by default with the Ocata updates because we kept
running into memory shortages. The other measures aimed at reducing RAM
usage introduced at the same time seem to have paid off, allowing us to
re-enable heat again.

Change-Id: Iff669dfba3d5d98cac603601af2d86f4d2c5ee4c

commit_message:
Fix missing Swift d1 directory

The /srv/node/d1 directory was missing, thus creating it in advance.

Note: there is a related change that merged earlier (f6108f5d) but
for some reason didn't work as expected.

Closes-Bug: 1746734
Change-Id: Iabaa2033d065c9da653f7ba9e25430c3554a1169

error:

commit_message:
Remove extras directory

In order to allow the easy addition of extra services to
config/scripts.*, the respective scripts need to exist in the scripts
directory. Therefore, the extras directory is not needed.

Change-Id: I2c0c3388b47188663c4e2cd02abdfff0cdf1fea4

commit_message:
try to validate the starting points for branches

Apply rules about where we expect branches to be created, when we
know. Also try to report errors in a way that makes it clear that
updating the branch settings after a branch has been created is
invalid.

Change-Id: I04befc1f3b0196ee2693bab5c61c399096c301a9
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

treat extra repos as errors

Require all repositories in a release to be listed in the
repository-settings section of the deliverable file.

Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
wrap subprocess to capture output in tests

Provide some wrappers around subprocess functions to capture stderr
and stdout and divert it to the logs so that the test output is less
cluttered with the output of various git commands.

Change-Id: If36ef013aca498e3a0a9cc3a2b78d666775439ab
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
deprecate the use of highlights attached to a release

We want teams to use reno for release notes and cycle-highlights for
more general notes. This patch disallows the use of release-specific
highlights for new releases from the new series with a message
explaining why. We can change the schema and let the yamllint perform
the check after running this way for a while.

Change-Id: I8e885b856f3412a3f6df691abbfd8c78037bcd91
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
Remove a duplicate colon

In 'Writing to the API' section of nova doc index page(*),
there is the 'Compute API Guide::' item.
It should be 'Compute API Guide:'.

* https://docs.openstack.org/nova/latest/#writing-to-the-api

TrivialFix
Change-Id: I59455c9783baccbf6ca7c6cf9da7f040f235de14

subject: Fix api's event listing query to sqlalchemy with non-admin user
revisions:
[{'created': '2017-08-18 02:51:28.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': " Fixing panko-api's query to sqlalchemy when listing event with non-admin user.

  Bug report: #1710812

 Original problem:

   Event storage backend is sqlalchemy(mariaDB).
   When listing events by:

         openstack event list [--limit n]
     or  ceilometer event-list [--limit n]

   using non-admin user, the number of events returned does not match the
   limit 'n'. It has much fewer events than it should have. Even when limit is
   not given, the default limit (100 if not changed) will apply and that the
   returned result is still wrong.

 Problems in code:

   In the file 'panko/storage/impl_sqlalchemy.py
   The subquery for trait filtering(project_id, user_id mostly) which generated in
   function 'get_events' into variable 'trait_subq' (start around line 269) does
   not seem behave correctly.

   In the original code, the subquery is being wrapped into a deeper layered
   subquery when a new trait is applied. The resulting complicated subquery makes
   results have duplicate 'event_id's. And duplicate ids still count for the
   amount of the result, resulting in much fewer number of events than the one
   'limit' flag sets.

 Fixing:

   This part(line 269-299) which generates the subquery is modified.
   For each trait, the table the trait is in is adding to the 'from' part of the
   query. As for the 'where' section, the trait is filtered, and the event_id
   should be the same as other ones.

   The function at the beginning is changed from '_build_trait_query' to
   '_get_model_and_conditions' which used by the part mentioned above.

   'sqlalchemy.orm.aliased' is imported to aliase tables since the same table may
   be selected multiple times, and it is required to apply 'aliased' to the table
   model before adding them to the query.

Change-Id: Ic303e4ed7af43c1d31559895c56a29b2c5ea85fc
", 'number': 1}, {'created': '2017-08-18 03:02:19.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Fix api's event listing query to sqlalchemy with non-admin user

Bug report: #1710812

Original problem:

  Event storage backend is sqlalchemy(mariaDB).
  When listing events by:

         openstack event list [--limit n]
     or  ceilometer event-list [--limit n]

  using non-admin user, the number of events returned does not match the
  limit 'n'. It has much fewer events than it should have. Even when
  limit is not given, the default limit (100 if not changed) will apply
  and that the returned result is still wrong.

Problems in code:

  In the file 'panko/storage/impl_sqlalchemy.py
  The subquery for trait filtering(project_id, user_id mostly) which
  generated in function 'get_events' into variable 'trait_subq' (start
  around line 269) does not seem behave correctly.

  In the original code, the subquery is being wrapped into a deeper
  layered subquery when a new trait is applied. The resulting
  complicated subquery makes results have duplicate 'event_id's. And
  duplicate ids still count for the amount of the result, resulting in
  much fewer number of events than the one 'limit' flag sets.

Fixing:

  This part(line 269-299) which generates the subquery is modified.
  For each trait, the table the trait is in is adding to the 'from' part
  of the query. As for the 'where' section, the trait is filtered, and
  the event_id should be the same as other ones.

  The function at the beginning is changed from '_build_trait_query' to
  '_get_model_and_conditions' which used by the part mentioned above.

  'sqlalchemy.orm.aliased' is imported to aliase tables since the same
  table may be selected multiple times, and it is required to apply
  'aliased' to the table model before adding them to the query.

Change-Id: Ic303e4ed7af43c1d31559895c56a29b2c5ea85fc
", 'number': 2}, {'created': '2017-08-18 06:25:22.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Fix api's event listing query to sqlalchemy with non-admin user

Closes-Bug: #1710812

Original problem:

  Event storage backend is sqlalchemy(mariaDB).
  When listing events by:

         openstack event list [--limit n]
     or  ceilometer event-list [--limit n]

  using non-admin user, the number of events returned does not match the
  limit 'n'. It has much fewer events than it should have. Even when
  limit is not given, the default limit (100 if not changed) will apply
  and that the returned result is still wrong.

Problems in code:

  In the file 'panko/storage/impl_sqlalchemy.py
  The subquery for trait filtering(project_id, user_id mostly) which
  generated in function 'get_events' into variable 'trait_subq' (start
  around line 269) does not seem behave correctly.

  In the original code, the subquery is being wrapped into a deeper
  layered subquery when a new trait is applied. The resulting
  complicated subquery makes results have duplicate 'event_id's. And
  duplicate ids still count for the amount of the result, resulting in
  much fewer number of events than the one 'limit' flag sets.

Fixing:

  This part(line 269-299) which generates the subquery is modified.
  For each trait, the table the trait is in is adding to the 'from' part
  of the query. As for the 'where' section, the trait is filtered, and
  the event_id should be the same as other ones.

  The function at the beginning is changed from '_build_trait_query' to
  '_get_model_and_conditions' which used by the part mentioned above.

  'sqlalchemy.orm.aliased' is imported to aliase tables since the same
  table may be selected multiple times, and it is required to apply
  'aliased' to the table model before adding them to the query.

Change-Id: Ic303e4ed7af43c1d31559895c56a29b2c5ea85fc

  When listing events by:

         openstack event list [--limit n]
     or  ceilometer event-list [--limit n]

  using non-admin user, the number of events returned does not match the

  limit is not given, the default limit (100 if not changed) will apply
  and that the returned result is still wrong.

  In the file 'panko/storage/impl_sqlalchemy.py
  The subquery for trait filtering(project_id, user_id mostly) which
  generated in function 'get_events' into variable 'trait_subq' (start
  around line 269) does not seem behave correctly.

  In the original code, the subquery is being wrapped into a deeper
  layered subquery when a new trait is applied. The resulting
  complicated subquery makes results have duplicate 'event_id's. And
  duplicate ids still count for the amount of the result, resulting in
  much fewer number of events than the one 'limit' flag sets.

Fixing:

  This part(line 269-299) which generates the subquery is modified.
  For each trait, the table the trait is in is adding to the 'from' part
  of the query. As for the 'where' section, the trait is filtered, and
  the event_id should be the same as other ones.

  The function at the beginning is changed from '_build_trait_query' to
  '_get_model_and_conditions' which used by the part mentioned above.

  'sqlalchemy.orm.aliased' is imported to aliase tables since the same
  table may be selected multiple times, and it is required to apply
  'aliased' to the table model before adding them to the query.

Patch:

  Fix coding style according to Julien Danjou's suggestion.

Change-Id: Ic303e4ed7af43c1d31559895c56a29b2c5ea85fc

  table may be selected multiple times, and it is required to apply
  'aliased' to the table model before adding them to the query.

commit_message:
Fix api's event listing query to sqlalchemy with non-admin user

Closes-Bug: #1710812

Original problem:

  Event storage backend is sqlalchemy(mariaDB).
  When listing events by:

         openstack event list [--limit n]
     or  ceilometer event-list [--limit n]

  using non-admin user, the number of events returned does not match the
  limit 'n'. It has much fewer events than it should have. Even when
  limit is not given, the default limit (100 if not changed) will apply
  and that the returned result is still wrong.

Problems in code:

  In the file 'panko/storage/impl_sqlalchemy.py
  The subquery for trait filtering(project_id, user_id mostly) which
  generated in function 'get_events' into variable 'trait_subq' (start
  around line 269) does not seem behave correctly.

  In the original code, the subquery is being wrapped into a deeper
  layered subquery when a new trait is applied. The resulting
  complicated subquery makes results have duplicate 'event_id's. And
  duplicate ids still count for the amount of the result, resulting in
  much fewer number of events than the one 'limit' flag sets.

Fixing:

  This part(line 269-299) which generates the subquery is modified.
  For each trait, the table the trait is in is adding to the 'from' part
  of the query. As for the 'where' section, the trait is filtered, and
  the event_id should be the same as other ones.

  The function at the beginning is changed from '_build_trait_query' to
  '_get_model_and_conditions' which used by the part mentioned above.

  'sqlalchemy.orm.aliased' is imported to aliase tables since the same
  table may be selected multiple times, and it is required to apply
  'aliased' to the table model before adding them to the query.

Test:

  $ tox -e py27-mysql

  The difference is at function 'test_get_event_multiple_trait_filter'
  in file '/tests/functional/storage/test_storage_scenarios.py'.
  The order of the traits to filter can affect how the original code
  produce the subquery, which is the cause of duplicate event_id.

Patch:

  1. Fix coding style according to Julien Danjou's suggestion.

  2. Add test code. Actually, modify existing one.

Change-Id: Ic303e4ed7af43c1d31559895c56a29b2c5ea85fc

commit_message:
Removes manila-generic-config from TripleO

Generic driver is not intended to be used in real environments
since it introduces a SPOF in the data path. Due to this, it
doesn't make sense and generates confusion to have the environment
file, so in this patch set we simply remove it.

Change-Id: I2e1db2bd614eae65e59712f50dc3391f16f6b388
Closes-Bug: #1708680

commit_message:
Update role test log collection

In order to improve the ability to debug role tests
better, we backport the latest log collection scripts
from master. We intentionally have removed anything
related to ARA (as that was implemented from Pike
onwards only), and SuSE/CentOS (as those were not
fully supported platforms until Pike).

Change-Id: I7fafbddb8a845241c38467e0a76470547f627408

subject: Use msgpack instead of msgpack-python
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-02-08 09:36:16.000000000', 'files': ['requirements.txt'], 'message': 'Use msgpack instead of msgpack-python

msgpack-python got renamed to msgpack (see
https://pypi.python.org/pypi/msgpack-python/0.5.1) and msgpack-python
is deprecated now.
This is important because other requirements already switched to
msgpack (eg. oslo.serialization) and installing both in parallel is
not possible for Distros.

Change-Id: I603eadbc2a5e1705375050920d5f1631c51a5a02
Closes-Bug: #1743445
(cherry picked from commit 2452958be4f4ef9c93d6ea2f1596e6040c17e24b)
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Use msgpack instead of msgpack-python

msgpack-python got renamed to msgpack (see
https://pypi.python.org/pypi/msgpack-python/0.5.1) and msgpack-python
is deprecated now.
This is important because other requirements already switched to
msgpack (eg. oslo.serialization) and installing both in parallel is
not possible for Distros.

Change-Id: I603eadbc2a5e1705375050920d5f1631c51a5a02
Closes-Bug: #1743445
(cherry picked from commit 2452958be4f4ef9c93d6ea2f1596e6040c17e24b)

commit_message:
Pass through templates_dir when running a minor update

Until now we were always reading
/usr/share/openstack-heat-templates. This means we'd be supporting
custom template location just for `overcloud deploy` but not
`overcloud update stack`.

Change-Id: Iddfd496c94da4b9c4552054d7000a9c36d4f6bf1
Partial-Bug: #1745988

', 'number': 1}, {'created': '2018-01-30 17:19:57.000000000', 'files': ['tripleoclient/v1/overcloud_update.py'], 'message': 'Use --templates argument for minor updates

commit_message:
Use --templates argument for minor updates

We support custom template path for `overcloud deploy`, we should do
the same for `overcloud update stack`.

Depends-On: Iddfd496c94da4b9c4552054d7000a9c36d4f6bf1
Change-Id: Iba8e02bdfa86515b433885e72990f6c6345d5aed
Closes-Bug: #1745988

commit_message:
Prevent latest mariadb version

Latest mariadb version has a bug that prevents clustering from
behaving properly in bootstrap.

Change-Id: I21e96dbe7fd9acaedb7eee7cba2ae226fa0644d5
(manually cherry picked from commit c54e9a68bc10380a5fad3363a8647994b033c8c2)

commit_message:
by default skip projects that have had tags applied

There is no need to show the contents of a release if the tag has
already been applied. Provide a command line option to be used when
running the tool interactively to disable this behavior, just in case.

Change-Id: I0db8075a750cba76eef40eb7a5656307ffe78992
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
only validate releases that have not yet been tagged

Change validate_releases() so that most of the rules are only applied
to a repository if it has not been tagged with the new tag value,
yet. This significantly speeds up the job.

Change-Id: I5f2ded1b2788d55d787027e0cc0bc93714ebfafc
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
make validate report more verbose

The validation job is doing a lot of work now and it isn't always easy
to tell which step causes which message. Add some headers and
formatting to separate the parts of the report from each other.

Change-Id: Iafdda1e48922b1ec966af3250fa8f0ff3dd79e97
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
only check release jobs if there are new releases to tag

We do not need to verify that a repo has valid release jobs configured
if we are only importing existing tags. This also helps us modify the
schema of older deliverable files if a repo hasn't been tagged in a
while.

Change-Id: I2b7c3091b9b3cfd7a9d550797a7154a56649f1ce
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

', 'number': 1}, {'created': '2017-10-26 11:48:45.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Add a StorageNFS network for use by Manila/Ganesha

This change adds a StorageNFS network. It's required by
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/471245 which implements
NFS Ganesha backend for Manila service.
This network will be disabled by default, and will be
enabled as part of the Isolated Networking configuration when
Ganesha is in use.

Co-Authored-By: Dan Sneddon <dsneddon@redhat.com>

This change adds a StorageNFS network. It's required by
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/471245 which implements
NFS Ganesha backend for Manila service.
This network will be disabled by default, and will be
enabled as part of the Isolated Networking configuration when
Ganesha is in use.

If enabled it's also necessary to add StorageNFSIpSubnet and
StorageNFSNetworkVlanID heat parameters into network templates.

Co-Authored-By: Dan Sneddon <dsneddon@redhat.com>

Change-Id: If31722d669efe91082c93ecb815e6c41676480c8
Partially-Implements: blueprint nfs-ganesha

commit_message:
Add a StorageNFS network for use by Manila/Ganesha

This change adds a StorageNFS network. It's required by
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/471245 which implements
NFS Ganesha backend for Manila service.

To define and enable the StorageNFS network, deploy using
network_data_ganesha.yaml instead of network_data.yaml.
Besides the former adding the StorageNFS network, these
are otherwise identical.

If enabled it's also necessary to add StorageNFSIpSubnet and
StorageNFSNetworkVlanID heat parameters into network templates.

Co-Authored-By: Dan Sneddon <dsneddon@redhat.com>

Change-Id: If31722d669efe91082c93ecb815e6c41676480c8
Partially-Implements: blueprint nfs-ganesha

commit_message:
Release Monasca and cut stable/queens

* monasca-agent        2.6.0
* monasca-api          2.5.0
* monasca-ceilometer   1.7.0
* monasca-common       2.8.0
* monasca-log-api      2.6.0
* monasca-notification 1.13.0
* monasca-persister    1.10.0
* monasca-thresh       1.5.0
* monasca-transform    0.14.0
* monasca-ui           1.12.0

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/541736
Change-Id: I5c531d9f8e6acd3ac950edfdddbcf060f57b02bd

subject: Make button positions consistent
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-01-31 19:48:42.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Make button positions consistent

This patch is an effort to make sure the button order in forms
(typically modals) are consistent and following the PatternFly
recommendations. The following forms buttons have been swapped
in order so that the buttons are all right aligned at the bottom
of the modals and the primary action is on the right while the
secondary actions are on the left:
- Import Plan Modal
- Update Plan Modal
- Deployment Configuration Modal (Overall Settings Tab)
- Deployment Configuration Modal (Parameters Tab)
- Role Configuration Modal
- Manage Roles Modal
- Delete Deployment Confirmation Modal
- Delete Nodes Confirmation Modal (uses same code as delete
deployment)
- Tag Nodes Modal (Also updated button label to read "Tag Nodes"
to be consistent terminology with all other buttons)

Change-Id: Ib28cc4075ae69efe6ab2e73a95521de0a1b579a4
Closes-Bug: #1647594

commit_message:
Make button positions consistent

This patch is an effort to make sure the button order in forms
(typically modals) are consistent and following the PatternFly
recommendations. The following forms buttons have been swapped
in order so that the buttons are all right aligned at the bottom
of the modals and the primary action is on the right while the
secondary actions are on the left:
- Import Plan Modal
- Update Plan Modal
- Deployment Configuration Modal (Overall Settings Tab)
- Deployment Configuration Modal (Parameters Tab)
- Role Configuration Modal
- Manage Roles Modal
- Delete Deployment Confirmation Modal
- Delete Nodes Confirmation Modal (uses same code as delete
deployment)
- Tag Nodes Modal (Also updated button label to read "Tag Nodes"
to be consistent terminology with all other buttons)

Change-Id: Ib28cc4075ae69efe6ab2e73a95521de0a1b579a4
Closes-Bug: #1647594

commit_message:
Replace six.iteritems with dict.items

According to https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/Python3,
now we should avoid using six.iteritems and replace
it with dict.items.

commit_message:
Deprecating the ceilometer collector and transformer

Ceilometer API is deprecated in Ocata Release[1], so
1 Removing the ceilometer collector and transformer from cloudkitty.
2 Setting the collector to gnocchi to get measures from Gnocchi rather
  than Ceilometer in devstack.
3 Updating the docs about ceilometer.

[1] https://docs.openstack.org/releasenotes/ceilometer/ocata.html#deprecation-notes

Change-Id: I280e9f8070e8eb323376b5fe0cbfbe55d6fc9536

commit_message:
Use msgpack instead of msgpack-python

msgpack-python got renamed to msgpack (see
https://pypi.python.org/pypi/msgpack-python/0.5.1) and msgpack-python
is deprecated now.
This is important because other requirements already switched to
msgpack (eg. oslo.serialization) and installing both in parallel is
not possible for Distros.

Change-Id: I603eadbc2a5e1705375050920d5f1631c51a5a02
Closes-Bug: #1743445

[{'created': '2018-02-07 16:30:49.000000000', 'files': ['tasks/upgrade/non_controller_upgrade_scripts.yml', 'tasks/upgrade/compute_detect.yml', 'tasks/upgrade/compute_upgrade.yml', 'tasks/upgrade/node_upgrade_script.yml'], 'message': 'Run compute upgrade only in compute hosts.

aside those hosts in which nova-scheduler and

Change-Id: If7bfd63d62509387be4b843d470816365f68cfaf
(cherry picked from commit 8d852b04913821c734d47e9d4fbdc052b85ce032)
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Run compute upgrade only in compute hosts.

The basic deployment used in TripleO CI
with only a controller is displaying
the controller in the openstack hypervisor
list command and tries running
upgrade-non-controller.sh on it, which fails.

With this change we plan to filter out
only those hosts with the compute role, leaving
aside those hosts in which nova-scheduler and
nova-compute are running at the same time.

Closes-Bug: #1747432
Change-Id: If7bfd63d62509387be4b843d470816365f68cfaf
(cherry picked from commit 8d852b04913821c734d47e9d4fbdc052b85ce032)

commit_message:
Restore DVR reference and convert graphics to SVG

OmniGraffle files required a license to be edited, and the
exported SVG wasn't editable in inkscape.

So we redraw the diagrams in inkscape, which is widely
available and free for everyone.

The architecture diagram has been joined into a single one
with the dotted alternative for distributed floating ips.

Change-Id: Ie74acdb5b10260b5803364ea0344efc0da27d674

commit_message:
Use secure random to generate transfer key

python random() is not suitable for generating random keys.
We better use SystemRandom for these purposes.

commit_message:
[reno] timeout parameter worked

We thought that the 'timeout' parameter that was specified for a
node's power state transition wasn't working for ipmitool, irmc,
and oneview power interfaces, but it turns out that it was working.
This updates the release note to reflect that.

Change-Id: Icc439179a3790f109d42c5014b11defbfd6c2127
Related-Bug: #1746849

commit_message:
Add test for showing encryption specs item

This patch adds test for the missing API (volume v2):
show specific encryption specs item for a volume type.

Including:

[1] Add show encryption specs item API to v2 encryption_types_client
[2] Add unit test for the API
[3] Modify test case: test_volume_type_encryption_create_get_update_delete
[4] Add release note

Change-Id: Idd91e39716f4acf6796412f3f67ef8b6771916f9

commit_message:
Convert Parameters form to use redux-form

Using Formsy in large forms causes performance problems

* Introduce ParametersForm and ParametersSidebar
* Add NewParameterInputList and NewParameterInput as the old ones are
  still used in role forms. After those are converted too, we'll rename
  these components
* Validate json parameter inputs
* Handle submitting of ParametersForm
* Separate updateParameters action to 3 actions: updateParameters,
  updateNodesAssignment, updateRoleParameters as those 3 dialogs all
  update parameters using the same mistral action but they handle it
  differently

Implements: blueprint ui-redux-form-migration
Closes-Bug: 1745408
Change-Id: I527f3587f8adce89be649c487d9a0df5ce4939d5

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-02-07 06:37:45.000000000', 'files': ['tempest/api/compute/admin/test_hypervisor_negative.py', 'tempest/api/compute/admin/test_hypervisor.py'], 'message': "Deprecate list_servers_on_hypervisor and search_hypervisor in v253

list_servers_on_hypervisor and search_hypervisor are deprecated starting
with microversion 2.53, so running tests using these interfaces will
get 404 error starting from microversion 2.53.

This is to limit these testcases to max_microversion = '2.52'.

For more information, please see:
https://developer.openstack.org/api-ref/compute/#list-hypervisor-servers
https://developer.openstack.org/api-ref/compute/#search-hypervisor

Change-Id: I877d3ce705f89beeed3c9d70ecba4b917e138f4c
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Deprecate list_servers_on_hypervisor and search_hypervisor in v253

list_servers_on_hypervisor and search_hypervisor are deprecated starting
with microversion 2.53, so running tests using these interfaces will
get 404 error starting from microversion 2.53.

This is to limit these testcases to max_microversion = '2.52'.

For more information, please see:
https://developer.openstack.org/api-ref/compute/#list-hypervisor-servers
https://developer.openstack.org/api-ref/compute/#search-hypervisor

Change-Id: I877d3ce705f89beeed3c9d70ecba4b917e138f4c

commit_message:
Adds missing Neutron TLS certificate/key generation

Neutron agents need key/certificate in order to communicate with OVS
using SSL.

Partial-Bug: 1746762

Change-Id: I4bbaf00f0776cab0be34d814a541fb2fd1e64326
Signed-off-by: Tim Rozet <trozet@redhat.com>

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-12-08 17:05:08.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Remove old import path in barbican client plugin

Change-Id: I340099ecf6649e7a443712a448a1504ec2e6d8ea
', 'number': 1}, {'created': '2018-01-12 14:45:54.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Remove old import path in barbican

Direct import of barbicanclient is being deprecated, we should use
barbicanclient.v1.

Change-Id: I340099ecf6649e7a443712a448a1504ec2e6d8ea
', 'number': 2}, {'created': '2018-02-07 04:58:18.000000000', 'files': ['heat/engine/clients/os/barbican.py'], 'message': 'Remove old import path in barbican

Direct import of barbicanclient is being deprecated for
`barbicanclient.containers`, we should use
`barbicanclient.v1.containers` instead.

Change-Id: I340099ecf6649e7a443712a448a1504ec2e6d8ea
', 'number': 3}]
commit_message:
Remove old import path in barbican

Direct import of barbicanclient is being deprecated for
`barbicanclient.containers`, we should use
`barbicanclient.v1.containers` instead.

Change-Id: I340099ecf6649e7a443712a448a1504ec2e6d8ea

- Make it voting in Pike and Queens.

commit_message:
3nodes: make it voting

- Remove the job in Ocata (failing and not maintained)
- Make it voting in Pike and Queens.

Having it voting will help to maintain it in good shape and avoid
regressions.

Depends-On: I9829845b83bd43e1d66f6be010369dde8ef47b5a
Change-Id: Ic01518be0c56cf4a41530822917411e77965b73b

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-10-16 09:42:29.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Pass storage nfs VIP to ceph-ansible

This VIP is needed in ceph-ansible to tell ganesha service
to listen on this IP only.
This parameter is passed through the endpoint map, it could be
done also by passing allNodesConfig to ceph-ansible (addressed
in patch https://review.openstack.org/#/c/509146/) and then getting
this value from allNodesConfig in tripleo-common ceph-ansible workbook.
Disadvantage of this alternative approach is that any parameter
change would require also change in tripleo-common.

Change-Id: I3c0da46dd0f0252158c6065b7c122b8567c88bc0
Partially-Implements: blueprint nfs-ganesha

commit_message:
Pass storage nfs VIP to ceph-ansible

This VIP is needed in ceph-ansible to tell ganesha service
to listen on this IP only.
This parameter is passed through the endpoint map, it could be
done also by passing allNodesConfig to ceph-ansible (addressed
in patch https://review.openstack.org/#/c/509146/) and then getting
this value from allNodesConfig in tripleo-common ceph-ansible workbook.
Disadvantage of this alternative approach is that any parameter
change would require also change in tripleo-common.

Depends-On: If31722d669efe91082c93ecb815e6c41676480c8
Change-Id: I3c0da46dd0f0252158c6065b7c122b8567c88bc0
Partially-Implements: blueprint nfs-ganesha

commit_message:
Add -n to lsof collection

To speed up the lsof report, let's use -n to skip network lookups as
this can significantly delay this command and should not be necessary in
the output.

Change-Id: Iba92d788173ff24424395bb137c226c457d4f637

commit_message:
Expose param to configure EventTTL

Currently we keep events in db forever. This could
cause performance issues. So lets expire periodically
and make it configurable.

Partial-Bug: #1746514

Depends-On: Iac1b0def39a4beb9b0f86ad306a991d7822e8b4e
Change-Id: I59efbcdc387b329103d72c0a254563a148c35d9d

commit_message:
Configure neutron notifier to use internal endpoint type for nova

Configure neutron so it selects the internal endpoint from the keystone
catalog for communicating with nova.

When we updated the client code on the te-broker to support some
changes that required newer clients we broke the instance liveness
check thanks to a backwards incompatibility in novaclient.  Since
all future te-brokers will be using the newer novaclient this change
just updates the Client creation call to use the new syntax.

Change-Id: Ib3331ee21c533f028007acae355528d9c5edbf76
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Update testenv-worker for newer novaclient

When we updated the client code on the te-broker to support some
changes that required newer clients we broke the instance liveness
check thanks to a backwards incompatibility in novaclient.  Since
all future te-brokers will be using the newer novaclient this change
just updates the Client creation call to use the new syntax.

Change-Id: Ib3331ee21c533f028007acae355528d9c5edbf76

commit_message:
OpenShift: Accept generic global parameters

This will allow arbitrary config of global variables for
openshift-ansible, e.g. customizing SDN params according to:

https://docs.openshift.org/3.6/install_config/configuring_sdn.html

Also remove the setting which was meant to disable OVS service
handlers in openshift-ansible -- that wouldn't solve the problem
fully.

Change-Id: Ib87e5d38797da166826af90659e3d05da3352dcf
Related-Bug: #1741224

commit_message:
Run compute upgrade only in compute hosts.

The basic deployment used in TripleO CI
with only a controller is displaying
the controller in the openstack hypervisor
list command and tries running
upgrade-non-controller.sh on it, which fails.

With this change we plan to filter out
only those hosts with the compute role, leaving
aside those hosts in which nova-scheduler and
nova-compute are running at the same time.

Closes-Bug: #1747432
Change-Id: If7bfd63d62509387be4b843d470816365f68cfaf

commit_message:
Added realtime NFV roles for OVS-DPDK and SR-IOV

Realtime roles could be deployed in a cluster along with the
non-realtime roles. The only difference is the image and few
parameters. Two roles, ComputeOvsDpdkRT and ComputeSriovRT, are
added.

Change-Id: Ieb43a83af46cf5d002eab8cb9a67431fefdd8d59

commit_message:
Make object server persist redirect location in async pending

Before, if the object server's container update gets a redirect
response then an async pending file was written, but the redirect
location was not included. So the object updater's first request would
be to the original location and presumably it would then get the same
redirect response.

Now, the async pending file includes any redirect location, so the
object updater can use that in its first request.

Change-Id: I0a0c391fdf5aeafc0644074b61ae8cce882ebc88

commit_message:
Zuul: Remove project name

Zuul no longer requires the project-name for in-repo configuration.
Omitting it makes forking or renaming projects easier.

subject: Always send redirected object updates to all container nodes
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-02-07 14:28:12.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Always send redirected object updates to all container nodes

Before, if an update request received success from some nodes and
redirect from others, the subsequent redirected update would only be
sent to a subset of shard container nodes whose indexes were not
previously recorded as successful.

Now, any redirect will cause memory of previous successes to be erased
so that all shard container nodes get sent the redirected update.

Also, tweak the stats logging so that redirects are not recorded as
failures, but are always recorded.

Also, refactor and try to minimise the changes in updater.py
w.r.t. master branch.

Change-Id: I556a34d501df9a9832b1ece05a18f8696b72650e
', 'number': 1}, {'created': '2018-02-07 18:13:16.000000000', 'files': ['swift/obj/updater.py', 'test/unit/obj/test_updater.py'], 'message': 'Always send redirected object updates to all container nodes

Before, if an update request received success from some nodes and
redirect from others, the subsequent redirected update would only be
sent to a subset of shard container nodes whose indexes were not
previously recorded as successful.

Now, any redirect will cause memory of previous successes to be erased
so that all shard container nodes get sent the redirected update.

Also, tweak the stats logging so that redirects are not recorded as
failures, but are always recorded.

Also, refactor and try to minimise the changes in updater.py
w.r.t. master branch.

Change-Id: I556a34d501df9a9832b1ece05a18f8696b72650e
', 'number': 2}]
commit_message:
Always send redirected object updates to all container nodes

Before, if an update request received success from some nodes and
redirect from others, the subsequent redirected update would only be
sent to a subset of shard container nodes whose indexes were not
previously recorded as successful.

Now, any redirect will cause memory of previous successes to be erased
so that all shard container nodes get sent the redirected update.

Also, tweak the stats logging so that redirects are not recorded as
failures, but are always recorded.

Also, refactor and try to minimise the changes in updater.py
w.r.t. master branch.

Change-Id: I556a34d501df9a9832b1ece05a18f8696b72650e

commit_message:
Don't observe reality if name property is None

We use `physical_resource_name` for name property in some
resources when name not provided during create, so we
shouldn't add name in resource_data if it's None in
property (might just the cases that we using
`physical_resource_name`).
Closes-Bug: #1737696

Change-Id: I7b6bcfdd748fdb8664245c4b65ec7170c2ad4a94

subject: Revert to root container if object update redirection loops
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-02-06 18:06:41.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Avoid object update redirection loops

Async pending file maintains list of previously
used redirect locations. If any is seen again then
ignore and route async update to the root container.

Also include a X-Backend-Redirect-Count header to inform
the root container how many redirects have occurred so that
the root might choose to accept the update into its
misplaced objects table (still to be implemented).

Add more unit tests for updater receiving bad Location header.

Change-Id: Ie4263b9f700c7a97b72e9cdf95c4854690b9c878
', 'number': 1}, {'created': '2018-02-07 12:40:24.000000000', 'files': ['swift/obj/updater.py', 'swift/container/server.py', 'test/unit/obj/test_updater.py'], 'message': 'Revert to root container if object update redirection loops

The async pending file now maintains a list of previously used
redirect locations. If a redirect is received to a location that has
been previously used, then it is ignored and the next attempt of the
async update is sent to the root container.

Note that the cycle could repeat, but at least there is now a
predictable fall back to the root container which is assumed to
eventually have the correct redirect location.

Add more unit tests for updater receiving a bad Location header.

Change-Id: Ie4263b9f700c7a97b72e9cdf95c4854690b9c878
', 'number': 2}]
commit_message:
Revert to root container if object update redirection loops

The async pending file now maintains a list of previously used
redirect locations. If a redirect is received to a location that has
been previously used, then it is ignored and the next attempt of the
async update is sent to the root container.

Note that the cycle could repeat, but at least there is now a
predictable fall back to the root container which is assumed to
eventually have the correct redirect location.

Add more unit tests for updater receiving a bad Location header.

Change-Id: Ie4263b9f700c7a97b72e9cdf95c4854690b9c878

TEMPEST_SERVICES global variable is not supported
by devstack since long back.
- I380dd20e5ed716a0bdf92aa02c3730359b8136e4
- I9c24705e494689f09a885eb0a640efd50db33fcf

Service availability of tempest known services will be
set by devstack with local check.
- I02be777bf93143d946ccbb8e9eff637bfd1928d4

This commit removes the unused TEMPEST_SERVICES setting
Related-Bug: #1743688

Change-Id: I596e45d0922686ce916fe4342d3d6357b57b91bb

subject: Supply outputs for reference IDs in StackResources
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-01-03 17:26:02.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Supply outputs for reference IDs in StackResources

Previously, in 1fff9516398e40f126a84a5fd6d2ad261838129b, we added outputs
to the generated templates of various nested stack resources that
referenced any attributes required to calculate the parent resource's
attributes. That was necessary because attribute values are not cached
unless they are referenced somewhere. It isn't necessary for reference IDs
(i.e. the results of get_resource) because those are always available.
However, providing reference IDs as outputs as well will allow us to get
all attributes of the parent resource from outputs of the nested stack.

Unlike ResourceGroup/Chain, in InstanceGroup and AutoscalingGroup the order
and content of the member in list-type outputs cannot be determined at
template generation time (failed resources are excluded, and the sort order
depends on creation time). Therefore, always use dicts instead of lists as
outputs, both for the new reference ID outputs in AutoscalingGroup and
existing attribute outputs. For ResourceGroup/Chain, create both dicts and
lists as appropriate, so that each attribute value can be obtained directly
from an output.

Change-Id: I3139246a5acb17df9018e7c7a2cf88f740b3f8be
Partial-Bug: #1731349", 'number': 1}, {'created': '2018-01-08 23:20:20.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Supply outputs for reference IDs in StackResources

referenced any attributes required to calculate the parent resource's
attributes. That was necessary because attribute values are not cached
unless they are referenced somewhere. It isn't necessary for reference IDs
(i.e. the results of get_resource) because those are always available.
However, providing reference IDs as outputs as well will allow us to get
all attributes of the parent resource from outputs of the nested stack.

Unlike ResourceGroup/Chain, in InstanceGroup and AutoscalingGroup the order
and content of the member in list-type outputs cannot be determined at
template generation time (failed resources are excluded, and the sort order
depends on creation time). Therefore, always use dicts instead of lists as
outputs, both for the new reference ID outputs in AutoscalingGroup and
existing attribute outputs. For ResourceGroup/Chain, create both dicts and
lists as appropriate, so that each attribute value can be obtained directly
from an output.

Change-Id: I3139246a5acb17df9018e7c7a2cf88f740b3f8be
Partial-Bug: #1731349
", 'number': 4}]
commit_message:
Supply outputs for reference IDs in StackResources

Previously, in 1fff9516398e40f126a84a5fd6d2ad261838129b, we added outputs
to the generated templates of various nested stack resources that
referenced any attributes required to calculate the parent resource's
attributes. That was necessary because attribute values are not cached
unless they are referenced somewhere. It isn't necessary for reference IDs
(i.e. the results of get_resource) because those are always available.
However, providing reference IDs as outputs as well will allow us to get
all attributes of the parent resource from outputs of the nested stack.

Unlike ResourceGroup/Chain, in InstanceGroup and AutoscalingGroup the order
and content of the member in list-type outputs cannot be determined at
template generation time (failed resources are excluded, and the sort order
depends on creation time). Therefore, always use dicts instead of lists as
outputs, both for the new reference ID outputs in AutoscalingGroup and
existing attribute outputs. For ResourceGroup/Chain, create both dicts and
lists as appropriate, so that each attribute value can be obtained directly
from an output.

Change-Id: I3139246a5acb17df9018e7c7a2cf88f740b3f8be
Partial-Bug: #1731349

commit_message:
Add description to update_upper_constraints patches

This adds a description to the patches that update the upper
constraints of projects, to indicate that the patch depends
on the branching of the openstack/requirements repository.

Change-Id: I58ab61715ec4876f722caa04869cedb0be822491

* telemetry integration tests run in tempest-venv so plugin
  needs to be installed in the same venv. devstack plugin installs
  the plugin all-plugin venv so tests are not discovered by tempest.
  In order to fix the same we need to use TEMPEST_PLUGINS vars for
  the same.
* telemetry integration tests are dependent on heat-tempest-plugin

Change-Id: Icab1e53d20bb7c95c232a4512e83905dcca7c599
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Fixed telemetry integration zuul jobs

* telemetry integration tests run in tempest-venv so plugin
  needs to be installed in the same venv. devstack plugin installs
  the plugin all-plugin venv so tests are not discovered by tempest.
  In order to fix the same we need to use TEMPEST_PLUGINS vars for
  the same.
* telemetry integration tests are dependent on heat-tempest-plugin
  so we need to add that to the required projects.

Change-Id: Icab1e53d20bb7c95c232a4512e83905dcca7c599

commit_message:
Add swift object copy function

Current Horizon does not have object copy page for swift.
This blueprint is for adding above one as Angular application.
- One row action is added as "Copy" menu
- User can copy which bytes > 0
  Because bytes = 0 means, true 0 byte object or separated file.
  Copying of separated object is not allowed in Swift API.

Implements: blueprint swift-object-copy-function
Change-Id: Ib82d2d0dae9d965531c14988db0d9ab8af72e123

commit_message:
Add UC Backup Mistral workflow definition and actions

This patch adds the workflow definition and actions
to perform an Undercloud backup.

Workflow can be executed as:
  mistral execution-create tripleo.undercloud_backup.v1.launch

Actions can be invoked as:
  mistral run-action tripleo.undercloud.get_free_space
  mistral run-action tripleo.undercloud.create_backup_dir
  mistral run-action tripleo.undercloud.create_database_backup \
    '{"path": "/tmp", "dbpassword": "", "dbuser":"root"}'
  mistral run-action tripleo.undercloud.create_file_system_backup \
    '{ "path": "/tmp/undercloud-backup-dCxQSn", "sources_path": "/home/stack/"}'
  mistral run-action tripleo.undercloud.upload_backup_to_swift
  mistral run-action tripleo.undercloud.remove_temp_dir

Related bp undercloud-backup-restore

Co-Authored-By: Sergii Golovatiuk <sgolovat@redhat.com>

Change-Id: Iebd67568d5e72967e694b88fc8c73361543929a1

commit_message:
Support deprecated NIC config names for legacy roles.

This patch enables a fix for bug/1737041 while supporting upgrades
from previous deployments where the NIC config template for the
role does not match the composable role name ,e.g. cinder-storage
for the BlockStorage role. This change looks for a property in
network_data.yaml, deprecated_nic_config_name.

Partial-Bug: 1737041
Change-Id: I49c0245c36de3103671080fd1c8cfb3432856f35

commit_message:
Fix swift auth issue by specifying version in url

Swift client does not always handle unversioned identity URL
properly. Leading to authorization failure because keystone cannot
handle incorrect path, returning 404.

To work around the issue, congress swift driver
specifies the version in url if none is already provided.

Partial-Bug: 1677380

Change-Id: I8df7dac60e4f7cb3c2ec792e13f687d5844c8409

subject: Rename deprecated context parameter
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-02-07 05:37:40.000000000', 'files': ['zun/common/context.py'], 'message': "Rename deprecated context parameter

According to https://review.openstack.org/#/c/498305/
The 'user' and 'tenant' parameter is deprecated.
However, we are still using it:
https://github.com/openstack/zun/blob/master/zun/common/context.py#L44
Let's follow oslo_context to rename 'user' to 'user_id' and
'tenant' to 'project_id'.

Change-Id: I2b041b27e275dd753d38a0f4ca0b191bfbe91269
Closes-Bug: #1747822
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Rename deprecated context parameter

According to https://review.openstack.org/#/c/498305/
The 'user' and 'tenant' parameter is deprecated.
However, we are still using it:
https://github.com/openstack/zun/blob/master/zun/common/context.py#L44
Let's follow oslo_context to rename 'user' to 'user_id' and
'tenant' to 'project_id'.

Change-Id: I2b041b27e275dd753d38a0f4ca0b191bfbe91269
Closes-Bug: #1747822

commit_message:
Zuul: Remove project name

Zuul no longer requires the project-name for in-repo configuration.
Omitting it makes forking or renaming projects easier.

Change-Id: I90fbc26626e172dd29e8c3812e45bbaf9151f196

subject: Update RHSM role to allow Satellite or Portal registration
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-02-06 20:24:47.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Major improvements to role structure and behavior

Remove unused files
Add rhsm_repository module from upstream
Update author information
Create tasks for Satellite registration
Separate task files based on the satellite version
Use rhsm_repository module for configuring repositories
Rearrange tasks so that registration and repository configuration takes place after configuration.
Change variable prefix and tags to rhsm_
Previously had some rhn_ prefixes and other rhsub_ prefixes. Now they are unified.
Correctly test for satellite version
Returned status codes are integrers not strings and therefore it's necessary to test against integers.
Insert default value for installation method using filter
Currently role defaults are not available when using static imports within a role.
Rename test VMs
Rename module and pull in changes

commit_message:
Do not pass credentials to the ramdisk on cleaning

Currently the driver_info is passed as is to the ramdisk when calling
get_clean_steps or execute_clean_step. This may lead to their exposure,
as ironic<->ramdisk communication is currently not secure.

This change applies the same logic we use in the API to filter
the fields.

Change-Id: I4fd44786fea6c7092d2b0029cea6d680d31babde
Closes-Bug: #1744836
(cherry picked from commit c2185469c4a9246fa62ceae76676a08ed84e686d)
